Thank you,

Jeff Manthei

post_text: Parents: Recently a new viral hoax has been floating around the internet called the "Momo Challenge." This hoax originally appeared in several other countries starting around July of 2018. This week the hoax has spread to the US. It has mainly spread by social media and some news outlets that have since retracted statements. The premise of the hoax is that "Momo" will either show up in YouTube videos related to things such as Fortnite or other children friendly videos and tell them to do harmful things to others or themselves. While the "Momo Challenge" is not real and is only a viral hoax, it makes a finer point to make sure that you monitor closely what your children are doing with their mobile devices and to highlight the dangers of the internet to them.

Leslie Public Schools first met with representatives from The Lockout Company last January. Since January, the District has been working on funding to purchase the system. The Competitive School Safety Grant program awarded by the State of Michigan and administered by the Michigan State Police will help make the SmartBoot System a reality for Leslie Public Schools.
